58978.「……ご ごめんなさい。\n 雪の女王なんて ホントは\n 最初から いなかった:
I'm sorry. There never really was a Snow Queen
in the first place.

58979.「悪い雪の女王が……って言ったほうが\n あなたも 気分が盛り上がるかなーって思:
I thought it might make you feel better if I
said the wicked Snow Queen... so I made a bit
of a story up.

58980.「ほら！ あれよ！ 今って ４月でしょ？: Look! That's it! It's April, right?

58981.「だから 今ならウソをついても いいのよ！\n そう。エイプリルフールってヤツ？:
So now it's okay to lie! Yeah. April Fool's
Day?

58982.どこからともなく 声が聞こえる……。: I hear voices coming out of nowhere...

58984.「ひっ！ ポっ ポワンさま！？\n たしか 妖精王の会合に\n 出席しておられる:
Hi! Treacle! I thought you were attending the
meeting of the fairy king...

58985.<center>どこにいようと 私は\n妖精の国のことを 見られるのですよ。\n:
Wherever you are, I can see what's going on in
Fairy Land. Of course, I have been watching
you all.

58986.<center>よく お聞きなさい ベラ……。\nウソには ついてよいウソと\n:
Listen to me very carefully, Honey... there
are some lies you can tell and some you can't.

58987.<center>あなたは 真実を語らずに\n<pc>を危険な目に あわせました。:
You put <pc> in danger by not telling
the truth. That is a lie you should not tell.

58988.「ごめんなさい……。本当のことを言います。\n じつは あの大きなナスビは\n:
I'm sorry... I'm going to tell you the truth.
The truth is, I accidentally produced those
big eggplants.

58989.「おいしいナスビが 食べたくなったので\n 立派な ナスビを育てようと ポワンさ:
I wanted to eat delicious eggplant, so I
secretly blew Treacle's Herald of Spring in an
attempt to grow some fine eggplant...

58990.「ナスビが 巨大な魔物になっちゃって\n 春風のフルートを奪って 雪の女王の洞く:
Nasubi turned into a giant monster, stole the
Herald of Spring, and ran away to Snow Queen's
Cave...

58991.「バレたら 絶対 怒られると思ったから\n 私 なんとかしなきゃって……。:
I knew they would definitely get mad at me if
they found out, so I had to do something...

58992.「昔 子供のキラーパンサーを連れた男の子が\n 雪の女王を やっつけてくれました:
A long time ago, a boy with a child Killer
Panther defeated the Snow Queen. That reminds
me of this lie...

58993.<center><pc>。ベラを許してあげてください。\nこの子は 悪い子ではな:
<pc>. Please forgive Honey. She's not
a bad girl. She's just a bit of a prankster.

58994.<center>春風のフルートは 私たち妖精の世界の\nとても大切な物です。\n:
The Herald of Spring is a very precious thing
in our fairy world. Thank you for getting it
back.

58995.<center>それでは 春の訪れを告げるとしましょう。\nベラ……。\nあなた:
So let's say spring has sprung. Honey you play
the Herald of Spring.

58996.「は…はいっ？ 私がですか？\n そんなの できっこないです……。: What... what? Me? You can't do that...

58997.<center>お聞きなさい ベラ。\nなぜ ただのナスが あんなにも\n巨大な:
Listen to me, Honey. Do you know how a mere
eggplant became such a huge monster?

58998.「えっ？ えっと それは……。\n 私が イタズラ心で\n 春風のフルートを 吹:
What? Well, it's because I played the Herald
of Spring as a prank...

59000.<center>ナスに命が宿ったのは\nあなたが フルートのチカラを\n操れるほ:
The eggplant came to life because you had
grown enough to manipulate the power of the
flute.

59001.「わ……私に フルートを操る\n チカラが……？: I have the power to control a flute?

59002.<center>さあ 春風のフルートを吹いてごらんなさい。\n今のあなたになら:
Go ahead, play the Herald of Spring. If you
can do it now, you can do it. You will herald
the arrival of spring in Fairy Land.

59004.「できた！ 私にも できたわ！！: I did it! I could do it!

59005.<center>……よくやりました ベラ。\n今の気持ちを 決して\n忘れてはな:
...Well done, Honey. You must never forget how
you feel now.

59006.「ありがとうございます ポワンさま！\n 春を呼ぶって どんなことなのか\n 私:
Thank you, Treacle! For the first time, I know
what it means to call spring!

59007.<center>これで 私も 安心しました。\n留守を頼みましたよ ベラ……。:
Now I feel safer, too. I asked you to stay,
Honey...

59008.「はいっ！ おまかせください！！: Yes, sir! Leave it to me!

59010.「あなたが 来てくれてなかったら\n 妖精の国に 春は 来なかったわ。\n 本当:
If you hadn't come, spring would never have
come to Fairy Land. Thank you so much!

59011.「だから お礼と ウソのおわびに\n これを受け取ってほしいの。:
So I want you to take this as a thank you and
to say sorry for lying to you.

59012.「せっかく春が来たんだから もうしばらく\n ゆっくりしていってね！ 春になった:
Now that spring has come, please take it easy
for a while longer! Fairy Land is so beautiful
in spring!

65702.「ごめんなさい……。本当のことを言います。\n じつは あの大きなタマネギは\n:
I'm sorry... I'm going to tell you the truth.
The truth is, that big onion was inadvertently
created by me.

65703.「おいしいタマネギが 食べたくなったので\n 立派な タマネギを育てようと ポワ:
I wanted to eat some good onions, so I
secretly blew Treacle's Herald of Spring to
grow some nice onions...

65704.「タマネギが 巨大な魔物になっちゃって\n 春風のフルートを奪って 雪の女王の洞:
The onion turned into a giant monster, stole
the Herald of Spring, and ran away to Snow
Queen's Cave...

65705.<center>お聞きなさい ベラ。\nなぜ ただのタマネギが あんなにも\n巨:
Listen to me, Honey. Do you know how a mere
onion became such a huge monster?

65706.<center>タマネギに命が宿ったのは\nあなたが フルートのチカラを\n操れ:
The onion came to life because you had grown
enough to manipulate the power of the flute.
